chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: From whence come wars and fightings among you? come they not hence, even of your lusts that war in your members?
items.plainText: From whence come wars and fightings among you? come they not hence, even of your lusts that war in your members?

items.text: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.
items.plainText: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.

items.text: Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume it upon your lusts.
items.plainText: Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume it upon your lusts.

items.text: Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.
items.plainText: Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

items.text: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?
items.plainText: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?

items.text: But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.
items.plainText: But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.

items.text: Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
items.plainText: Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

items.text: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.
items.plainText: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.

items.text: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to heaviness.
items.plainText: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to heaviness.

items.text: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.
items.plainText: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.

items.text: Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.
items.plainText: Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.

items.text: There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?
items.plainText: There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?

items.text: Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:
items.plainText: Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:

items.text: Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.
items.plainText: Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.

items.text: For that ye ought to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.
items.plainText: For that ye ought to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.

items.text: But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.
items.plainText: But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.

items.text: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.
items.plainText: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.
